{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with symptoms of excessive sleepiness in the evening and inability to stay awake past 6 pm. He does not have any symptoms of obstructive sleep apnea such as snoring, daytime sleepiness, or waking up feeling unrefreshed. He also does not have symptoms of chronic insomnia such as difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking up too early. His symptoms do not seem to be due to normal aging as they are causing significant distress and impairment in his social functioning.
